metadata.title: Thursday, 16th October, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when construction of staff houses at Chipili District Headquarters will be completed;
(b)    what challenges, if any, Government has encountered in completing the project; and
(c)    whether the Government is satisfied with the progress made so far.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when works on Katete-Mtelezi-Msoro Road will commence;
(b)    what the nature of the works to be carried out are;
(c)    which contractor will work on the road; and
(d)    what the time-frame for the project is.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to introduce a public medical insurance scheme;
(b)    if so, whether the scheme will benefit the poor and vulnerable people in rural areas; and
(c)    what has caused the delay in introducing such a scheme.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development when the Government will facilitate the construction of a filling station in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    what has caused the delay in completing the rehabilitation of the Sesheke-Livingstone Road;
(b)    how long it has taken to resurface the 38km stretch of the Road; and
(c)    why the rehabilitation exercise did not start from Sesheke.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development what measures have been taken to reduce incidences of load-shedding by ZESCO Ltd in the following residential areas of Kabwe
parts: (a)    Ngungu;
(b)    Chimanimani; and
(c)    Bwacha.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when the Goat Breeding Centre at Chabilikila in Nchelenge will be re-established.

parts: (a)    what the main rice varieties grown in Zambia are;
(b)    of the varieties above, which ones are mainly intended for export; and
(c)    what measures the Government has taken to increase and improve the quality of rice grown in Zambia.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    what future plans the Government has for the Zambia Agency for Persons with Disabilities (ZAPD);
(b)    why the Government has neglected ZAPD; and
(c)    whether the Government has any plans to abolish ZAPD.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to establish a trades training centre in Kaputa District;
(b)    if so, when construction of the centre will commence; and
(c)    what the estimated period of construction is.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when rehabilitation of the following Roads in Kaoma Central Parliamentary Constituency will commence
parts: (a)    Njonjolo;
(b)    Lombelombe;
(c)    Shimana;
(d)    Naliele; and
(e)    Kalumwange.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    whether Kabwe is among the districts to benefit from the funds reserved for the rehabilitation of markets country-wide;
(b)    what criteria were used in choosing the eligible districts; and
(c)    whether there is room to revise the list of beneficiary districts for 2014.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the upgrading of the following mud and grass thatched community schools to portal framed schools in Kaputa Parliamentary Constituency will commence:
(i)    Kawama; (ii)   Mataka; (iii)  Watenwa; (iv) Kalangwa;
(v)  Chitaba; and (vi) Kakote;
(b)    how many community schools were upgraded from pole and mud to portal framed structures in Kaputa District from January to August, 2014; and
(c)    what the names of the upgraded schools are.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to expand the water supply network in the township area of Sesheke District; and
(b)    when the old water supply lines will be rehabilitated.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when dip tanks will be constructed in the following areas in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Chimtende;
(b)    Vulamkoko;
(c)    Garven;
(d)    Zinaka;
(e)    Mpoto; and
(f)    Nyembe. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (10th October) - Resumption of Debate.
